context.name: NDS_CLI
context.description: This is the server root context.

context.name: Applications
context.description: This level is used to view and modify applications entries.

context.name: MDBManagement
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Database Management and Monitoring applications.

context.name: MariaDB
context.description: This level is used to configure the Database Management application.

context.name: AuditLog
context.description: This level is used to view and modify audit logging for the Database Management application

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view logging-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify logging-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default logging severity level.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of the logging thread. The value "1" indicates the lowest priority and "5" indicates the highest.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of the logging queue.

parameter.name: showThreadName
parameter.description: This parameter enables thread name logging.

context.name: InputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear input channels entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view input channels-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify input channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging input channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging to the logging input channel on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the severity level of the logging input channel.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear input channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging input channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: OutputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear output channels.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view output channels-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify output channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging output channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging to the logging output channel on and off.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the directory where the log files are located.

parameter.name: filePrefix
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the prefix of the log files.

parameter.name: fileSizeInMB
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of a log file.

parameter.name: numberOfFiles
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of log files that exist before the old log files are deleted.

context.name: Backups
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the backups configuration in the Database Management application.

command.name: get
command.description: >This level is used to view backups configuration in the Database Management application.

command.name: set
command.description: >This level is used to modify backups configuration in the Database Management application.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: encryption
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the algorithm used to encrypt the backups. When None is selected, the backups are not encrypted.

context.name: Tasks
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the backup tasks configured in the Database Management application

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the configured backup tasks.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add backup tasks to the Database Management application.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label associated with this backup task.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the backup method used for this task.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the repository where the backup is stored.

parameter.name: frequency
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency to execute the backup task.

parameter.name: Weekly
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the weekly frequency.

parameter.name: weekdays
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a day of the week to execute the weekly backup.

parameter.name: Monthly
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the monthly frequency.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the day of the month to execute the monthly backup.

parameter.name: startTime
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time to execute the backup task.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify backup task attributes.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label associated with this backup task.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the backup method used for this task.

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the repository where the backup is stored.

parameter.name: frequency
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency to execute the backup task.

parameter.name: Weekly
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the weekly frequency.

parameter.name: weekdays
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a day of the week to execute the weekly backup.

parameter.name: Monthly
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the monthly frequency.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the day of the month to execute the monthly backup.

parameter.name: startTime
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time to execute the backup task.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove backup tasks from the configuration.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the label associated with this backup task.

context.name: Bindings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the interface and port bindings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display bindings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the interface and port binding.

parameter.name: componentName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the component name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: interface
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the network interface to use for this component.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: portNumber
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number to use for this component.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the general settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display the general settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the general settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: segment
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the group segment this member is part of. Same segment members are treated as equally physically close.

parameter.name: encryptReplication
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether replication traffic is encrypted. This parameter must be enabled on all cluster nodes to encrypt communication between the nodes.

context.name: Schemas
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the database schemas.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view database schemas.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a database schema.

parameter.name: schema
parameter.description: The name of a schema to modify.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a database schema.

parameter.description: The name of a schema to remove.

context.name: Users
context.description: This level is used to view and modify database users for external access to views.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to list the current users with their role.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify user attributes.

parameter.name: name

parameter.name: attribute

parameter.name: password

context.name: Monitor

context.name: JVMStatsCollector
context.description: This level is used to configure the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector settings.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to configure the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables or disables data collection for JVM statistics.

parameter.name: statisticsRefreshPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency at which BroadWorks fetches PMs from JVM Mbeans.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: Monitoring
context.description: This level is used to view and modify monitoring entries to check the status of the system, troubleshoot issues using logs and audit trails, and review performance and reports.

context.name: Alarm
context.description: This level is used to view and modify alarms. BroadWorks servers trigger alarms and include the ability to obtain and view these alarms. A BroadWorks server alarm can be informational, low severity, medium severity, high severity, or critical severity. Please refer to the application specific fault and alarms Management Information Base (MIB) for a detailed list of alarms.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to get and search for system alarms. These are alarms are located in the local CLI buffer.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: A type of alarm sub-component to filter on.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as a trap type.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: TrapType
parameter.description: This nester parameter determines the trap type. *Use ''notification'' to display the traps at informational purposes. *Use ''alarm'' to display the reporting alarms. *Use ''software error'' to display the software errors.

parameter.name: trapName
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as a trap name.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the trap name.

parameter.name: problem
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as problem text.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: ProblemText
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a text element that may represent an actual trap text (partially or entirely).

parameter.name: subcomp
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as a BroadWorks software component or area.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Subcomponent
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the software component within the BroadWorks entity that is reporting the alarm: "SIP", "database", and so on. Refer to the BroadWorks fault MIBs for a list valid sub-components.

parameter.name: recommendation
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as recommendation text.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: RecommendationText
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a text element that may represent an actual trap recommended action text (partially or entirely).

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter is based on the state of an alarm.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: AlarmState
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the state of an alarm.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter based on the trap generation time. The acceptable time formats are as follow: * MM/DD/YY hh:mm AM|PM * MM/DD/YY

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the date and time the alarm was generated.

parameter.name: comp
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as an entity reporting the alarm.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Component
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the BroadWorks entity reporting the alarm. Refer to the BroadWorks fault MIBs for a list valid entities.

parameter.name: sysname
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter as the system name.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: SystemName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the host name of the system running the BroadWorks software.

parameter.name: trapSeverity
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter based on alarm severity.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Severity
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the severity. *"Informational Warning": no immediate problems. *"Low": minor problem with a possible service impact. *"Medium": minor problem with a minor service impact. *"High": major problem with a major service impact. *"Critical": emergency system outage.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the filter based on alarm ID.

parameter.name: relation
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the relation. *"<= ": less than or equal to. *"==": equal to. *>=: greater than or equal to. *"HAS": is inclusive of.

parameter.name: Identifier
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a sequentially generated number that is used to uniquely identify the alarm.

parameter.name: back
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a report based on the last N alarms.

parameter.name: numAlarms
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the number of alarms to move back.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to view and modify the size of the CLI buffer for alarms. The recommended buffer size is "1,000" alarms.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: localsize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the local alarms backlog size (in number of alarms). Note that , alarms are searched and displayed by accessing the local backlog and not the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) agent's backlog. This parameter returns to its default value ("1000") for each new CLI session.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP agent alarms backlog size (in number of alarms). The SNMP agent backlog size determines how many alarms are stored in memory and (optionally) on disk and represents the maximum number of alarms that can be retrieved by CLI clients. When the actual number of historical alarms overflows the ''size''parameter, the oldest alarms are deleted. The''localsize''is limited by the ''size''.

parameter.name: logging
parameter.description: This parameter turns logging on and off. When the values is "false", logging to disk is turned off. Logging to disk allows alarms to be persisted across SNMP agent restarts. When the value is "true", logging to disk is turned on. Logging to disk allows alarms to be persisted across SNMP agent restarts.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to delete alarms from the local CLI backlog buffer, from the SNMP agent backlog buffer, and from disk.

command.name: ShowConfig
command.description: This command is used to display the alarm-related configuration.

command.name: close
command.description: This command is used to close the connection with the SNMP agent, which is used to obtain system alarms and event logs generated by the BroadWorks Server.

command.name: open
command.description: This command is used to open a connection with the SNMP agent to obtain system alarms and event logs generated by the BroadWorks Server. When opening system alarms, the port to be used is specified. If a port is not specified the agent default is used.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port used to communicate with the SNMP agent. When not specified the agent default is used.

command.name: show
command.description: This command is used to enable or disable real-time alarm echoing. When real-time alarm echoing is enabled, alarms display at the CLI as they occur. When alarms occur, they appear in the window from which this command was invoked. To avoid interrupting other BroadWorks Server CLI commands, open a separate window.

parameter.name: onoff
parameter.description: This parameter enables the alarm show funtion. The ''on'' option enables the alarm show function. The ''off'' option disables the alarm show function.

context.name: AlarmsTable
context.description: This level is used to clear a specific active alarm, clear all active alarms, list currently active alarms, resend an active alarm, and resend all active alarms. When an alarm is raised, its state is set to "On". When an alarm is resolved and cleared by the server, its state is set to "Off". When an alarm is manually cleared, its state is set to "Cleared". "Off" and "Cleared" alarms are equivalent; however, a "Cleared" alarm indicates that the alarm was cleared manually.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear an alarm.

parameter.name: identifier
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the identifier of the alarm to resend.

command.name: clearAll
command.description: This command is used to clear all active alarms.

command.name: list
command.description: This command is used to display the list of currently active alarms.

command.name: resend
command.description: This command is used to resend a currently active alarm to a remote host.

parameter.name: identifier
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the identifier of the alarm to be resent.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the remote host that the alarm is sent to.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number of the remote host.

command.name: resendAll
command.description: This command is used to resend all currently active alarms to a remote host.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter identifies the remote host that the alarm is sent to.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port number of the remote host.

context.name: Threshold
context.description: This level is used to define thresholds against alarms defined for the BroadWorks Server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view a list of the alarm thresholds defined on the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new threshold against an alarm defined in the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: maxNumTrapsPerTimePeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of traps for the time period.

parameter.name: timePeriodInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time period (in seconds).

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the alarm is active or inactive.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Note that problem text variables can be defined.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable1
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable2
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable3
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable4
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable5
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a threshold against an alarm defined in the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the index number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Note that problem text variables can be defined.

parameter.name: maxNumTrapsPerTimePeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of traps for the time period.

parameter.name: timePeriodInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time period (in seconds).

parameter.name: problemTextVariable1
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable2
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable3
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable4
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: problemTextVariable5
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a problem text variable filter (one of five) that is defined per threshold. When the agent compares the content of this problem text variable, the comparison is not case sensitive.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the alarm is active or inactive.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing alarm threshold.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the index number.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear all alarm threshold attributes.

parameter.name: alarmName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the alarm name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the index number.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Note that problem text variables can be defined.

context.name: Default
context.description: This level is used to set the system default alarm threshold attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the system default alarm threshold attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the system default alarm threshold attributes defined on the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: maxNumTrapsPerTimePeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of traps for the time period.

parameter.name: timePeriodInSeconds
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the time period (in seconds).

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the attribute is active or inactive.

parameter.name: minSeverity
parameter.description: This parameter determines the severity level. Valid values include: "informational", "low", "medium", "high", and "critical".

context.name: PM
context.description: This level is used to navigate and view the values of the Management Information Base (MIB) nodes. Performance Measurements (PMs) are used to monitor the BroadWorks server performance, as well as, the operating system and hardware performance. To simplify navigation, PMs are organized in a tree structure.

context.name: ConfigurationManagement
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Performance Measurements (PMs) of the ConfigurationManagement

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the Management Information Base (MIB) node values. MIB node values can be viewed in the following ways: All performance measurements throughout the MIB nodes tree structure. Performance measurements related to the current node. Performance measurements of a specified path.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter displays Performance Measurements (PMs). Use the "-r" option to display all PMs for the current tree structure of the Management Information Base (MIB) nodes. Use the "-f" option to display a full description of PMs.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the path of the node of the Performance Measurements (PMs) to view.

parameter.name: tableKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of a row key for a node (to display as a table).

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify a Management Information Base (MIB) node values.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Use the ''counter'' option to set a scalar entry in a MIB (outside of a table). Use the ''table'' option to set a value in a table.

parameter.name: counter
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of an individual counter.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a node in the Management Information Base (MIB).

parameter.name: value

context.name: Maintenance
context.description: This level is used to view and modify maintenance entries to check the general status of the system and the software that is currently running.

context.name: ContainerOptions
context.description: This level is used to view and modify special configuration options for Java containers. These options are typically used to control specific behaviors introduced by patches.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of container options and their values.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new container option.

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type of container.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option name.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option value.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify an existing container option.

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type of container.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option name.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option value.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete a container option.

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type of container.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the option name.

command.name: removeObsolete
command.description: This command is used to remove the container options that are documented as obsolete.

command.name: showOption
command.description: This command is used to view information about a specific container option.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of a container option. The container option specified will be searched across all available containers.

command.name: showOptions
command.description: This command is used to view a list of container options or display information about a specific container.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the criteria of the container options and the name of the container to search.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: This parameter filters the output of the container option definitions to contain the definitions currently available or the obsolete definitions. When omitted, it displays all container options.

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the filter should match available or obsolete container options.

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: This parameter is used to view the container options that apply to the specified container. If omitted, all the container options currently available for this server are listed.

parameter.name: containerName
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a specific container.

context.name: ManagedObjects
context.description: This level is used to view and modify Managed Objects (MOs).

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Managed Object (MO)-related information.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the option. *Use the "broadworks" option to view information about the BroadWorks component installed on the current host. *Use the "devices" option to view information about the devices configured for use with the current host. *Use the "versions" option to view information about the version of the BroadWorks component installed on the current host.

parameter.name: broadworks
parameter.description: This parameter displays information on the active BroadWorks server: identity, version, applications, web container, and third-party software.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute. Use the ''full'' option to get an extended view of the status of the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: devices
parameter.description: This parameter displays device information.

parameter.name: filters
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the filter to use to narrow the result of the get command.

parameter.name: deviceName
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of a device. When it is used, the GET command applies a case-sensitive prefix match on all device names.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the protocol supported by the device.

parameter.name: deviceType
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the type of the device to display.

parameter.name: adminState
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the administrative state of the device.

parameter.name: opState
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the operating state of the device.

parameter.name: versions
parameter.description: This parameter displays information on the installed software on this server.

command.name: detail
command.description: This command is used to display detailed information about an application. Data presented in the output includes the application name, version, install date, upgrade mode, status, and description.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type of element.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter displays information of a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of the application.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the version of the application.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the Managed Object (MO)-related attributes.

parameter.name: forceOption
parameter.description: This parameter determines the force option. Use the "force" option to apply the change immediately. Otherwise, a restart of the application is required for the changes to apply.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the options.

parameter.name: activeSoftwareVersion
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the active software version.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This nested parameter determines the version of the server. Use this option when a different version of the server needs to be activated. The software automatically determines if it needs to upgrade or rollback.

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: This parameter specifies server-related information.

parameter.name: identity
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of the server identity to set to "active". It is usually the short name of a BroadWorks server (for example, Profile Server, Network Server, and so on).

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the version of the software to activate.

parameter.name: revert
parameter.description: This parameter provides the ability to revert to a previous release. Use the "revert" option to perform a revert to the specified previous release. Otherwise, a rollback to the specified previous release is performed.

parameter.name: revert
parameter.description: This parameter provides the ability to revert to a previous release. Use the "revert" option to perform a revert to the specified previous release. Otherwise, a rollback to the specified previous release is performed.

parameter.name: backupLocation
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the full path of the database backup file to use when performing a revert.

command.name: activate
command.description: This command is used to activate an application. Active applications can be configured, deployed, and started.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type. Use the "application" option to activate a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to activate a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of the application.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the application version.

parameter.name: contextPath
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the context path.

command.name: deactivate
command.description: This command is used to deactivate an application.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter determines which software is deactivated.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to deactivate a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: nameOrContextPath
parameter.description: The name or context path of the application.

command.name: deploy
command.description: This command is used to deploy an application.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter determines which software type is deployed.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to deploy a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: nameOrContextPath
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name or context path of the application.

command.name: lock
command.description: This command is used to lock the server. Upon normal completion, the server goes into the ''Lock'' state. During the stop process, the server temporarily goes into the ''Locking'' state. This command can be run when the server is in the ''Unlock'' state. Refer to the BroadWorks Software Management Guide for further details on server state management.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the option. Use the "force" option if the lock must be enforced even if the lock target is not ready to go into the ''Lock'' state.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to lock a BroadWorks application. If a specific application must be locked individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the lock applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of an application.

command.name: start
command.description: This command is used to start the server. Upon normal completion, the server goes into an ''Unlock'' state. Note that this command can only be run when the server is in a ''Shutdown'' state.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type. If a specific application or the web container must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to start a BroadWorks application. If a specific application must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of an application.

command.name: stop
command.description: This command is used to stop the server. Upon normal completion, the server goes into a ''Shutdown'' state. During the stop process, the server temporarily goes into the ''Shuttingdown '' state. This command can be run from any state.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the option. Use the "force" option if the stop must be enforced even if the target is not ready to go into the ''Stopped'' state.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type. If a specific application or the web container must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to stop a BroadWorks application. If a specific application must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of an application.

command.name: undeploy
command.description: This command is used to undeploy an application.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type. If a specific application or the web container must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to undeploy a BroadWorks application. Use the "application" option to undeploy a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: nameOrContextPath
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name or context path of the application.

command.name: unlock
command.description: This command is used to unlock the BroadWorks server. Once the command is executed, the server goes into the Unlock state. This command is executed when the server is in the Lock state.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the type. If a specific application or the web container must be started individually, this parameter must be set. This is an optional parameter and, if not set, the start applies to the whole server.

parameter.name: application
parameter.description: This parameter determines the "application" option to unlock a BroadWorks application.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the name of an application.

context.name: Patching
context.description: This level is used to display detailed information about patches or patch bundles. It is also used to apply patches, check peers, execute operations, modify files, list patches or patch bundles, display the history of a patch, refresh the patch database or remove a patch. This level provides additional services for patches such as showing more details and performing batch operations based on a given filter (for example, apply or remove installed patches and delete inactive patches).

command.name: detail
command.description: This command is used to display detailed information for the requested patch or patch bundle. Data presented in the output for a patch includes the patch name, the current state of the patch, and the date since it reached this current state. It also shows the first level of patches on which it depends (dependencies), the patches directly depending on it (dependents) and the name of the patch bundle(s) in which it is found. Data presented in the output for a patch bundle displays a list of the bundled patches and their states.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the patch or patch bundle.

command.name: apply
command.description: This command is used to change the state of installed patches to "active". When an error occurs, all patches are brought back to their initial state.

parameter.name: names
parameter.description: This parameter specifies names of the patches or bundles to apply delimited by colons.

command.name: checkPeer
command.description: This command is used to verify (on a redundant system) that all servers have the same active patches. The command scans all peers and compiles a list of all active patches on all servers. It then compares the list of each individual server with the full list and displays any missing patches for a particular server. This command is exclusive meaning that requests for any other command, invoked by any client, are rejected while this command is executing.

command.name: execute
command.description:
This command is used to commit patch operations and make them effective.
This command commits all changes since the last time the "execute" was called, and makes them effective. Modifications to patches states are not active until this call is made. This command is exclusive meaning that requests for any other command, invoked by any client, are rejected while this command is executing.

parameter.name: force
parameter.description: This parameter commits the patch operations and makes them effective.

command.name: getModifiedFile
command.description: This command is used to list the patches that modified the file requested in the query.

parameter.name: fileNameContains
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a pattern that is contained in one or more file names.

command.name: listBundle
command.description: This command is used to display a list of patch bundles or one or more specific patch bundles.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the criteria. Enter the name of the desired patch bundle or a given pattern that matches a pattern found in one or more patch bundle names.

parameter.name: bundleNameContains
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the filtering option. Use ''bundleNameContains'' to filter based on the bundle name.

parameter.name: bundleName
parameter.description: Specifies a pattern that is contained in a number of patch bundle names.

command.name: listPatch
command.description: This command is used to display a list of patches along with their states. All patches appear no matter if they were installed or applied individually or as part of a patch bundle. Data presented in the output of this command includes the patch name, the current state of the patch, and the date since the patch reached the indicated state. Search criteria can be used to narrow the output of results. The patchNameContains is used to list patches matching a given pattern in their name, whereas the currentState is used to list patches with a specified state.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the criteria. Enter the name of the desired patch bundle or a given pattern that matches a pattern found in one or more patch bundle names.

parameter.name: patchNameContains
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a filter based on the content of the patch name.

parameter.name: patchName
parameter.description: Specifies a pattern that is contained in a number of patch names.

parameter.name: currentState
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a filter based on the current state of a patch.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: The state of the patch.

command.name: listRelation
command.description: This command displays all dependencies or dependents of a given patch along with their states.

parameter.name: option
parameter.description: This parameter determines the type of relation to display. Values include "dependencies" and "dependencyOf". Use the "dependencies" option to view all patches which are required to be applied before the given patch. Use the "dependencyOf" option to view all patches which are required to be removed before the given patch.

parameter.name: patchName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the patch.

command.name: patchHistory
command.description: This command is used to display the history of one or more patches. Data presented in the output of this command includes the patch name, the date of an event for the patch, and the state of the patch at that time. Search criteria can be used to narrow the output of results. The "dateStartsAt" criterion is used to set a starting date so that the results do not include events prior to this date. It is also possible to retrieve the history of patches matching a given pattern in their name, or a combination of both criteria.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the desired patch bundle or a given pattern that matches a pattern found in one or more patch bundle names.

parameter.name: patchNameContains
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a filter based on the content of the patch name.

parameter.name: patchName
parameter.description: Specifies a pattern that is contained in a number of patch names.

parameter.name: dateStartsAt
parameter.description: Filter based start at date.

parameter.name: month
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the the month of starting date so that the results do not include events prior to this date.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the day of starting date so that the results do not include events prior to this date.

parameter.name: year
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the year of starting date so that the results do not include events prior to this date.

command.name: refresh
command.description: This command is used to refresh the patch database. This command is exclusive, which means that requests for any other command, invoked by any client, are rejected while the refresh command is executing. This command analyzes the patches installed on the system. From the gathered data, it updates the internal database and processes dependencies.

command.name: remove
command.description: This command is used to change the state of active patches to "installed." When an error occurs, all patches are brought back to their initial state.

parameter.name: names
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the names of the patches or bundles to remove delimited by colons.

context.name: Scheduler
context.description: This level is used to view and modify scheduler entries in the system.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the list of scheduled tasks.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a new scheduled task. You can configure a task to execute on a minute, day, or date basis. Any given task can have multiple-scheduled entries. Following are examples: * The command "taskx minute 2" means execute the task "x" every two minutes. * The command "taskx day monday 0 30" means execute task "x" every Monday at 0h30. * The command "taskx date 15 2 15" means execute task "x" on the 15th of each month at 2h15.'''NOTE''': To minimize the impact of running concurrent scheduled tasks, use minutes that are different between tasks and that do not match the hour (when applicable).

parameter.name: tasks
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the BroadWorks maintenance task type.

parameter.name: frequency
minute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minute.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the frequency in minutes. For example, "1" means every minute, "2" means every two minutes and so on.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies the start of the hour offset value in minutes. It is important that not all tasks are executed at the same time. The different offset for each task manages the execution of tasks.

parameter.name: daily
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the daily option.

parameter.name: hour
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a day in the week.

parameter.name: minute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minute.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a specific day in the week.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a specific day in the week.

parameter.name: hour
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a day in the week.

parameter.name: minute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minute.

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a specific day in the month.

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a specific day in the month.

parameter.name: hour
parameter.description: This nested parameter specifies a day in the week.

parameter.name: minute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the minute.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a scheduled task from the list. Scheduled tasks must be deleted using their corresponding ID number.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ID for the scheduled task.

context.name: FileCollector
context.description: This level is used to view and modify file collector task attributes.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the file collector task attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the file collector task attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the URI to identify the remote log repository.

parameter.name: keepFileAfterTransfer
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the files are preserved after transfer.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user to connect to the log repository web application.

command.name: clear
command.description: This command is used to clear the user attribute of the file collector task.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to clear.

context.name: SrcDestPathsContext
context.description: This level is used to add and modify file collector task source and destination paths.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the file collector task source and destination paths.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add the source and destination paths to the file collector task.

parameter.name: sourcePath
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the source path of the logs on the local machine. This source path can contain wildcards.

parameter.name: destinationPath
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination path of the remote machine.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove the source and destination paths from the file collector task.

parameter.name: sourcePath
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the source path of the logs on the local machine. This source path can contain wildcards.

context.name: Ticket
context.description: This level is used to interact with ticket system (BroadSoft's problem reporting system). It is used to upload a file as an attachment to an existing ticket.

command.name: upload
command.description: This command is used to upload a document from the local server to an existing ticket.

parameter.name: UserId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ticket system user ID.

parameter.name: TicketId
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ticket ID number. TicketId pattern is <String {1 to 10 characters}>-<Integer {1 to 9999999999}> or <Integer {10000 to 999999}>.

parameter.name: FileName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the file name of the file to be uploaded.

parameter.name: FileDescription
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the description of the file to be uploaded.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the ticket system user password.

context.name: Tools
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the tools entries.

command.name: healthmon
command.description: This command is used to report the status.

command.name: tech-support
command.description: This command is used to capture the status of the system.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify. Tech-support includes some information extracted from log files on disk. Use the ''day'' option to get this information for a specific day in the month.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the date of a day in the month.

command.name: upgradeCheck
command.description: This command is used to perform a software activation dry run during which a system validation is performed to determine if the upgrade will be successful.

parameter.name: version to switch to
parameter.description: Specifies the version to which the system is upgraded.

context.name: Interface
context.description: This level is used to view and modify interface-related attributes.

context.name: Ldap
context.description: ERROR *** UNKNOWN CONTEXT ***

context.name: Client
context.description: This parameter specifies the client configuration settings.

command.name: get

parameter.name: baseDistinguishedName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the distinguished name of the search base(for example, dc=broadsoft,dc=com).

parameter.name: bindPassword
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the credentials to bind to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter specifies whether the BroadWorks Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) client is enabled.

command.name: clear

parameter.description: This parameter specifies the local user name for which the group membership lookups are not performed to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server. This can be useful in case of unavailability of the LDAP server.

parameter.description: This parameter specifies the local user name for which the group membership lookups are not performed to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server. This can be useful in case of unavailability of the LDAP server.

context.description: This parameter specifies the server connection.

parameter.description: This parameter specifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server.

parameter.name: port

context.name: SNMP
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) agent.

context.name: AccessList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the list of entries in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) access list.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the nodes that currently can access the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) agent.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a node to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) access list. To obtain performance measurements, the SNMP manager must have access to the individual nodes in the network. The SNMP manager Internet Protocol (IP) address is used by the agent to identify managers that are granted access.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of an external Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) manager.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a node from the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) access list. When the node is removed from the access list, it is longer able to obtain performance measurements from the SNMP Agent. The node's IP address is used to identify the manager.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of an external Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) manager.

context.name: Agent
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the current Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent settings, modify the listening port, modify the read community string, or modify the write community string. You can set the source address that is used to send traps, which supports configurations whereby a server can have multiple network interfaces, including a dedicated maintenance/management interface.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the current Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port used to communicate to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether ISO-8859-1 or UTF-8 (Unicode) encoding is used by the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent to send traps.

parameter.name: readCommunity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the read community string used to access the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

parameter.name: writeCommunity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the write community string used to access the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

parameter.name: trapCommunity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the trap community string used by the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent when sending SNMP Traps.

parameter.name: trapSourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the trap source for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

choice.description: An IP interface that is currently defined on the server.

parameter.name: disableV2
parameter.description: This parameter is used to disable Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v2.

context.name: JVMStatsCollector
context.description: This level is used to configure the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector settings.

context.name: GeneralSettings
context.description: This level is used to configure the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

command.name: set
command.description: The command is used to modify the general settings of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) statistics collector.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter enables or disables data collection for JVM statistics.

parameter.name: statisticsRefreshPeriod
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the frequency at which BroadWorks fetches PMs from JVM Mbeans.

context.name: HeapUsageThreshold
context.description: This level is used to configure the heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the heap usage threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: NonHeapUsageThreshold
context.description: This level is used to configure the non-heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view the non-heap usage threshold settings.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the non-heap usage threshold settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether a threshold is active.

parameter.name: armValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for enabling a threshold crossing.

parameter.name: resetValue
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a value for clearing a threshold crossing.

context.name: Logging
context.description: This level is used to view and modify logging for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Agent.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view logging-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify logging-related attributes.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the attribute to be modified.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the default logging severity level.

parameter.name: priority
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the priority of the logging thread. The value "1" indicates the lowest priority and "5" indicates the highest.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size of the logging queue.

parameter.name: showThreadName
parameter.description: This parameter enables thread name logging.

context.name: InputChannels
context.description: This level is used to view, modify, or clear input channels entries.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view input channels-related attributes.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify input channels-related attributes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the logging input channel.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: This parameter turns the logging to the logging input channel on and off.

parameter.name: severity
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the severity level of the logging input channel.

context.name: TrapTable
context.description: This level is used to view and modify entries in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view information in the current Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table, such as the IP address of the machine the BroadWorks server is sending traps to and the corresponding port.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a node to the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table. To send traps, the BroadWorks server must be able to identify the node where traps are sent. This is usually a machine designated as the central point for monitoring. The node's IP address and port are used to identify the node.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the node.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the node.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: This parameter determines how Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) traps are sent. When the value is set to "shared", the SNMP Agent wraps every trap in an envelope with the same name. The recipient can receive three different types of envelopes: a notification, an alarm, or a software error. The content of the envelope provides an explanation of the source of the problem. When the value is set to "unique", the SNMP Agent sends every instance of a notification in a different envelope. Each of these uniquely identifies the problem without having to open the envelope.

parameter.name: useAlarms
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the system sends pairs of notifications or alarms. This is a backward-compatibility flag.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify an entry in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the node.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the node.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: This parameter determines how Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) traps are sent. When the value is set to "shared", the SNMP Agent wraps every trap in an envelope with the same name. The recipient can receive three different types of envelopes: a notification, an alarm, or a software error. The content of the envelope provides an explanation of the source of the problem. When the value is set to "unique", the SNMP Agent sends every instance of a notification in a different envelope. Each of these uniquely identifies the problem without having to open the envelope.

parameter.name: useAlarms
parameter.description: This parameter determines if the system sends pairs of notifications or alarms. This is a backward-compatibility flag.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove a node from the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) trap table. Nodes removed from the SNMP trap table are no longer sent traps. The node's IP address and port are used to identify the node.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the node.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the port of the node.

context.name: AccessLevels

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

command.description: This command is used to add Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 access levels to a group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a level of access for the group. When the value is set to "all", complete access is provided; when the value is set to "management", access to the managed objects is provided; when the value is set to "performance", access to the performance measurements is provided.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 access levels from a group.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the group.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a level of access for the group. When the value is set to "all", complete access is provided; when the value is set to "management", access to the managed objects is provided; when the value is set to "performance", access to the performance measurements is provided.

context.name: V3Users
context.description: This level is used to view, add, modify, delete and clear the V3 User level attributes. The V3 User level provides support for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) version 3 (SNMPv3). The primary feature of SNMPv3 is additional security. The only security feature in SNMPv2 is the support of community strings (that can be viewed as a simple password with no user name). SNMPv3 supports multiple user name/password pairs, as well as encryption. System administrators are able to configure the version of SNMP that BroadWorks should support (v2 or v3), as well as parameters specific to each version. View-based Access Control Model (VACM) is supported with three predefined views: all, management and performance. It is configurable through the V3 user group attribute and the V3AccessControl level.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to view Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user-related attributes.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) V3 user.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

parameter.name: read
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for read access.

parameter.name: write
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for write access.

parameter.name: security
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the security implemented for this Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 user.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: Additional attributes to include through the add command.

parameter.name: authenticationKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user authentication key.

parameter.name: privacyKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the privacy key used for encryption.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 group name.

parameter.name: write
parameter.description: This parameter determines whether this user is authorized for write access.

parameter.name: security
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the security implemented for this Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 user.

parameter.name: authenticationKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user authentication key.

parameter.name: privacyKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the privacy key used for encryption.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the user Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 group name.

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to delete an existing Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v3 user.

parameter.description: This parameter specifies the SNMP v3 user ID. It is required to perform SNMP v3 access to the server.

parameter.description: This parameter specifies the value of the java.net.preferIPv4Stack property used to start starting java processes. The default value is "true". It must be set to "false" to to use IPv6 for the process.

parameter.name: configureIPFilter
parameter.description: This parameter indicates whether or not Broadworks configure the IP filtering functionality of the OS. In case the functionality currently supported by Broadworks is not sufficient, an administrator could manually configure the IP filtering function by setting this parameter to false. When doing, the file produced by Broadworks containing the rules are still produced but are not transferred into the OS.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to get the last applied profile tuning name.

command.name: apply
command.description: This command is used to apply a specific tuning profile. The printed output lists the difference between the current values stored within the configuration and the new values that will be set by applying the profile.

parameter.name: profileTuningName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the selected profile tuning.

command.name: describe
command.description: This command is used to print the configuration changes performed by a profile. The printed output lists the difference between the current values stored within the configuration and the new values that would be set by applying the profile. No configuration changes are applied.

parameter.name: profileTuningName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of the selected profile tuning.

context.name: Resources

context.name: Memory
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the memory allocation rules for the applications running on the server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to show memory allocation general settings. They include the over-allocation protection, which will adjust the container memory allocation if the configured memory settings exceed physical memory available.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to set memory allocation general settings.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: overAllocationProtection
parameter.description: This parameter controls whether the software manager adjusts the containers memory allocation if the configured memory settings exceed the physical memory available. The default value is "true".

context.name: Containers
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the memory allocation rules for each container.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display container memory allocation settings and runtime values.

command.name: set
command.description: This command is used to modify the memory allocation settings for a container. For the purpose of the set command, the memory can be expressed as an amount of memory (in megs) or a percentage of physical memory. Modifying one of the values causes the other to be recalculated.

parameter.name: containerName
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the container name.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The name of an attribute to modify.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the amount of memory that is allocated to a container (in megs).

parameter.name: percentage
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the percentage of physical memory that is allocated to a container.

context.name: BlackList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Access Control List (ACL) black list security options for the BroadWorks server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display network security-related attributes. It displays the Access Control List (ACL) black list that filters inbound network packets to the BroadWorks server. Packets that match entries in the black list are processed by the BroadWorks server.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an entry to the Access Control List (ACL) black list.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the sourceIp/sourceMask pair as a subnet range of IPs. The sourceIp is always the string representation of the IP whether IPv4 or IPv6.

parameter.name: Mask
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the source mask. It is in dotted string format for IPv4 (for example, 255.255.0.0) or the number of bits in the mask for IPv4 and IPv6.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the packet matches against this IP address. This is one of the configured IP addresses of the BroadWorks server.

parameter.name: destinationPortFirst
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the first port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: destinationPortLast
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the last port of the range of inbound packets that match against a range of destination ports. For protocol Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), this is "0".

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: This parameter determines the received network packet matches against this protocol. Values include" "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

command.name: delete
command.description: This command is used to remove an entry from the Access Control List (ACL) black list.

context.name: WhiteList
context.description: This level is used to view and modify the Access Control List (ACL) white list security options for the BroadWorks server.

command.name: get
command.description: This command is used to display the network security-related attributes. It displays the Access Control List white list that filters inbound network packets to the BroadWorks Server. Packets match entries in the white list to be processed by the BroadWorks server.

command.name: add
command.description: This command is used to add an entry to the Access Control List ( ACL) white list.
